title: 106_s1210
content: Foreign Endangered Species Conservation Act of 1999 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to use amounts in the Foreign Endangered and Threatened Species Conservation Account to provide financial assistance for projects for the conservation of foreign endangered or threatened species in foreign countries. Prescribes project requirements. Directs the Secretary to: (1) coordinate efforts to conserve foreign endangered and threatened species with the relevant agencies of foreign countries. And (2) provide such agencies with technical assistance to further their conservation efforts. Establishes the Foreign Endangered and Threatened Species Conservation Account within the Multinational Species Conservation Fund of the Treasury. Authorizes appropriations.
